result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Weston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: JAIL in lieu of $553.00 costs, consecutive to this case.

Huber.
  Stayed-Defendant to call Jail Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 3 business days or by 8-26-2015 for report date by 10-23-2015.  Failure to do so within the specified time will result in the immediate issuance of a commitment to Jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
JAIL in lieu of $543.00 costs, consecutive to this case.
